question: The rise of convenience food has helped people keep up with the speed of modern lifestyle. Do the advantages outweighs the disadvantages.
text: Nowadays, because of the busy activity due to work and increasing expenses for daily leaving, many people rely on readily cooked foodstuff that help them to keep up the pace of current lifestyle. This essay will discuss the pros and cons of this trend.

To begin with, there are various reasons of why people find it helpful to be dependent on processed food. Firstly, the amount of the expenses of our daily needs is increasing therefore many people are busy working and every minute of their life is important. This can be illustrated by those who work in the office they have to wake up early and prepare meals and even packed lunch, so it should be food that is not easily spoiled. Secondly, some job required to do overtime so they could finish the time frame, they just eat instant food just to fill their stomach such as noodles or microwavebable meals.

However, there are always two sides of a coin. We all know that the major disadvantage of convenience food is our health. It is evident that the amount of obesity in the world is increasing and the main reason for that is bad eating habits. It is scientifically proven that process food remain in our body for a longer of time and that will lead to cancer. Therefore, if the body affects badly by the food we eat, all the struggle for working hard will be a waste if we did not careful of what we eat. Minimizing the habit of eating fast food could prevent for the said possible negative impact to our body.
In conclusion, in spite of the benefits of convenience food in our life, the consequence that may affect our life forever are more important.
